hook.text: Gordon Parks bought his first camera at a pawnshop for $7.50. He became one of America's greatest visual voices.

buildup.text: Parks was the first Black photographer at Life magazine and a pioneer of documentary and fashion photography.

discovery.text: His photo essay 'Segregation Story' exposed the daily humiliation of Jim Crow â€” seen through Black eyes.

twist.text: Parks was also a filmmaker, author, composer, and poet. Photography was one voice among many.

climax.text: He called the camera his 'weapon of choice' against racism, poverty, and injustice.

punchline.text: A $7.50 camera changed how America saw itself.

quiz.question: What historic achievement did Gordon Parks hold at Life magazine?
options: He was the first Black staff photographer
